data.enText: public/political activities
events that are of public interest or political importance

data.chText: 世界 / 国际 / 商业事务
data.enText: world/international/business affairs
an expert on foreign affairs (= political events in other countries)
affairs of state
event
an event that people are talking about or describing in a particular way

data.chText: 报章毫无根据地夸大了整个事件。
data.enText: The newspapers exaggerated the whole affair wildly.

data.chText: 那次辩论使人颇感失望。
data.enText: The debate was a pretty disappointing affair.

data.chText: 她希望庆祝活动仅限于家人参加。
data.enText: She wanted the celebration to be a simple family affair .
relationship

data.chText: （尤指已婚男女的）私通，风流韵事
data.enText: a sexual relationship between two people, usually when one or both of them is married to sb else
She is having an affair with her boss.
private business
matters connected with a person's private business and financial situation
I looked after my father's financial affairs.

data.chText: 她想在去世前把自己的事务安排妥当。
data.enText: She wanted to put her affairs in order before she died.
a thing that sb is responsible for (and that other people should not be concerned with)

data.chText: 我如何用钱是我自己的事。
data.enText: How I spend my money is my affair.
object

data.chText: 不寻常之物；难描述的东西
data.enText: an object that is unusual or difficult to describe

data.chText: 她的帽子嵌着羽毛，帽檐很宽，真是件奇物。
data.enText: Her hat was an amazing affair with feathers and a huge brim.
a state of affairs
a situation

data.chText: 再不能无视这种情况了。
data.enText: This state of affairs can no longer be ignored.

means: (尤指已婚男女的)私通，风流韵事

ex.chText: 这件事很严重，你需要集中精力解决。
ex.enText: This is a serious matter that you need to concentrate on.

ex.chText: 这是该由经理决定的事。
ex.enText: This is a matter for the manager to decide.

synonyms.bx: 通常指关乎利益、命运等的紧要事务，必须予以考虑或解决。

ex.chText: 谁最先报道了水门事件？
ex.enText: Who first reported the Watergate affair?
The wedding was a very grand affair.

synonyms.bx: 指令人印象深刻的重大事件或具有某种特点的不寻常之事。

ex.enText: She is interested in public affairs.

ex.chText: 不要总是打听我的财务问题。
ex.enText: Don't keep asking about my financial affairs.

tips.tip: affairs 表示公共或政治事务、活动，也可指私事。

ex.chText: 我们来处理尚未了结的事务吧。
ex.enText: Let's get down to the unfinished business.

ex.chText: 我的家庭生活是我的私事。
ex.enText: My family life is my personal business.

ex.chText: 他把作业当作重要的事。
ex.enText: He regarded homework as serious business.

synonyms.bx: 指需要完成或讨论的重要事务，也指归某人管的事或某人持有某种看法的事情。

ex.enText: What is a mother's main concern?

ex.chText: 如何控制通货膨胀已成为消费者关注的重要问题。
ex.enText: How to control inflation has become a major concern for consumers.

synonyms.bx: 指关系到某人切身利益、引起其关注或担忧的重要事情。

ex.chText: 那件奇怪的事情让他十分不安。
ex.enText: That strange thing worried him a lot.

ex.chText: 首要的事是改善他们的工作环境。
ex.enText: The first thing to do is to improve their working conditions.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，词义最为广泛，可指任何事实、事件、情况、行为等。

data.enText: a state of affairs
a situation

data.chText: 再不能无视这种情况了。
data.enText: This state of affairs can no longer be ignored.

example: it is none of your affair
the party was quite an affair
an occasion arranged to honor the president
a seemingly endless round of social functions

tr: a usually secretive or illicit sexual relationship

value.def: If an event or a series of events has been mentioned and you want to talk about it again, you can refer to it as the affair .

example.ex: The government has mishandled the whole affair...
example.tran: 政府对整个事件处理不当。

example.ex: The affair began when customs officials inspected a convoy of 60 tankers...
example.tran: 就在海关关员检查一个60艘油轮的船队时，事情发生了。

example.ex: The industry minister described the affair as 'an absolute scandal'.
example.tran: 工业部长将此事件形容为“绝对的丑闻”。

value.def: You can refer to an important or interesting event or situation as 'the ... affair'.

example.ex: ...the damage caused to the CIA and FBI in the aftermath of the Watergate affair.
example.tran: 水门事件发生后给美国中央情报局和联邦调查局造成的不良影响

example.ex: ...confidential Bank of England documents relating to the BCCI affair.
example.tran: 与国际信贷商业银行事务相关的英格兰银行的机密文件

value.tran: …事件（指重要或有趣的事件或情况）

value.def: You can describe the main quality of an event by saying that it is a particular kind of affair .

example.ex: Michael said that his planned 10-day visit would be a purely private affair...
example.tran: 迈克尔说他所计划的10天访问纯属个人私事。

example.ex: Breakfast will be a cheerless affair for the Prime Minister this morning.
example.tran: 今天的早餐会让首相感觉全然无味。

value.def: You can describe an object as a particular kind of affair when you want to draw attention to a particular feature, or indicate that it is unusual.

example.ex: All their beds were distinctive; Mac's was an iron affair with brass knobs...
example.tran: 他们的床都各具特色；马克的床是张带球形黄铜柱头的铁家伙。

example.ex: He tried dividing it into two bundles, tying them to his walking stick, and slinging the whole affair across his back.
example.tran: 他试着将它分成两包绑在他的拐棍上，然后把所有东西都挂在后背上。

value.tran: （不寻常的或具有某种特点的）东西

value.def: If two people who are not married to each other have an affair, they have a sexual relationship.

example.ex: She was having an affair with someone at work.

value.def: You can use affairs to refer to all the important facts or activities that are connected with a particular subject.

example.ex: He does not want to interfere in the internal affairs of another country...
With more details, here's our foreign affairs correspondent.
example.tran: 详细情况，请听我们外交事务记者的报道。

value.def: Your affairs are all the matters connected with your life which you consider to be private and normally deal with yourself.

example.ex: He was rational and consistent in the conduct of his affairs...
example.tran: 他处理私事时头脑清楚，始终如一。

example.ex: The unexpectedness of my father's death meant that his affairs were not entirely in order.
example.tran: 家父的猝然离世留下了尚未完全安排妥当的身后事。

value.def: If you say that a decision or situation is someone's affair, you mean that it is their responsibility, and other people should not interfere.

example.ex: If you wish to make a fool of yourself, that is your affair...
example.tran: 如果你想让自己出丑，那是你自己的事。

example.ex: If they want to stay and fight, then I guess that's their affair.
example.tran: 如果他们想留下来打架，我想那是他们自己的事。

trans: 风流韵事；(非夫妻间的)性关系；(对某事)极大的热情，强烈的兴趣
外遇；有了生平第一次外遇；婚外恋；出轨
